body: Discussed with @prodia4 !

Have you measured the exact elapsed time for drawing pixels? (I will make issue for this performance test.)
In my careful opinion, slow-drawing is because of google maps drawing.
If this is really drawing pixels performance issue, asynchronous call for draw / erase may overcome this issue.
Duplicate in #16

Case 1: When VIEW_GRID_ZOOM_DIFF = 3, showing about 400 pixels on the screen, drawing takes about 3~400 mil seconds. 

Case 2: When it is 4, showing about 1200 pixels on the screen, drawing takes about 1 second and skips some frames. (I/Choreographer: Skipped 57 frames!  The application may be doing too much work on its main thread.)

Adding the pixel instances itself(without drawing the polygons) has no overhead, taking about 1~10 ms in both case 1 & 2.
Thanks. Maybe we will need profiling if performance issue matterss
GH-23 solved this
Need to clear cache before we test. (We need to find a way)
If confirmed, please close this issue @mrgomdev @YoungsooJang
3.4332275390625E-4, the difference between east and west longitudes.

Regarding the tests(I only checked the part in ServerInterfaceTest as this pull request has not been merged yet), They definitely pass, but when I bring the same logic to the app and actually run it, ANR happens.(When the UI thread of an Android app is blocked for too long, an "Application Not Responding" (ANR) error is triggered.) Could you check it please?

1. I Need to know the firebaseId of the watching pixel when watchingPixelChanged is called, but currently fbPixel, which is passed to PixelEvents.watchingPixelChanged, does not contain firebaseId. How about including id(firebaseId) as a member variable in FBPixel?

2. What is the use case of readPixelInstantly?

Other than that, the api seems good to me for now.

1. I will add PixelData parameter at the event function. I don't want to add PixelData at the FBPixel. I will make a pull request soon.
2. updateParent and unit tests.
@YoungsooJang @mrgomdev Okay for you? I will close this issue at tomorrow.
Currently compressing by PNG at the Firebase storage.
about 20m  -- We think this is enough.

@prodia4 In `ServerInterfaceTest`, I used `writePixelSync` and `getBitmapSync`, which are synchronous functions that can block main thread. I used these synchronous functions because of ease of unit testing. (In fact, almost synchronous functions are for just testing.) Please prefer async versions of the methods in the app side.
Maybe we can find some examples/library in girhub repo. Keywords can be `android color picker` or something like that.

OK. However we have to consider to allow to click neighbor pixels.
